post_text:
Good evening,

Governor Lamont announced this afternoon that all schools will reopen in the fall. Guidelines for this reopening will be provided next week. The ReOpen Shelton Schools Executive Committee will work with our advisory committees to review these guidelines and put a plan together for our district in the best interest of staff, students, parents and the community. The health and wellbeing of our students, staff, parents and the community will continue to be our top priority. Additional information regarding our plans will be communicated and posted on the Shelton Public School website and Facebook pages. Please continue to check there for updates, practice social distancing and stay safe.

Dr. Smith
Interim Superintendent
text:

The health and wellbeing of our students, staff, parents and the community will continue to be our top priority. Additional information regarding our plans will be communicated and posted on the Shelton Public School website and Facebook pages. Please continue to check there for updates, practice social distancing and stay safe.

Dr. Smith

post_text:
Good morning,

There are several items owned by the Shelton Public Schools that need to be collected from students at the end of the year. Some of these include chromebooks, iPADs, textbooks, library books, teacher-loaned books, athletic uniforms, fees, graphing calculators, band equipment, technology equipment, etc. We also realize that there may be some items that students need to pick up, such as art projects and mentee gift bags. Attached are the end-of-year procedures for students. The parent of any student who needs to pick up materials or clean out their locker must email their respective building principal prior to the designated date for their school drop off. Anything left beyond the last call date will be disposed of. Honor letters/certificates and promotion/retention letters will be mailed this year. Report cards will be sent via Infinite Campus. The procedures for distribution of yearbooks, caps and gowns, t-shirts, class gifts, etc. will be communicated in the future when these items have been delivered to the schools.

Dr. Smith
Interim Superintendent

post_text:
Attached you will find the 19-20 Family Meal Application. Families may be eligible, based on their current financial status, to apply for benefits for the current school year until June 30. If approved, the benefits are in effect for the first 30 days of the new school year, 20-21.

To apply, parents/guardians may email their applications to accountspayable@sheltonpublicschools.org or mail them:

Accounts Payable

Shelton Public Schools

382 Long Hill Avenue

Shelton, CT 06484

Parents/guardians may also find the application, a FAQs for the meal program document, and information on applying for SNAP (food stamp) benefits using the Shelton Public Schools website under: District Info>School Lunch Program.

post_text:
The Shelton Board of Education adopted the attached Shelton Public Schools Distance Learning Alternate Grading Plan For the COVID-19 Health Crisis on April 30, 2020.

For the third trimester, elementary schools will grade in the same manner as in the past, using progress codes on report cards. For the fourth quarter, students in grades 5 through 12 will continue to earn traditional grades A through D and Distance Learning Incomplete for those in the failing range, unless they opt to choose the Shelton Public Schools Distance Learning Alternate Grading Plan For the COVID-19 Health Crisis. To continue to earn traditional grades, parents and students in grades 5 through 12 do not have to do anything. Parents of students who would choose the alternate grading option must complete the attached form and email it to your building principal by 12:00 p.m. on Friday, May 29, 2020
text:
The Shelton Board of Education adopted the attached Shelton Public Schools Distance Learning Alternate Grading Plan For the COVID-19 Health Crisis on April 30, 2020.

For the third trimester, elementary schools will grade in the same manner as in the past, using progress codes on report cards. For the fourth quarter, students in grades 5 through 12 will continue to earn traditional grades A through D and Distance Learning Incomplete for those in the failing range, unless they opt to choose the Shelton Public Schools Distance Learning Alternate Grading Plan For the COVID-19 Health Crisis. To continue to earn traditional grades, parents and students in grades 5 through 12 do not have to do anything. Parents of students who would choose the alternate grading option must complete the attached form and email it to your building principal by 12:00 p.m. on Friday, May 29, 2020

post_text:
As we continue with Distance Learning, it is time to finalize a decision on grading practices for the third trimester/fourth quarter. Commissioner of Education Cardona released guidance on grading indicating the determination of grading policies and approaches continues to remain at the local level. I put together a comprehensive grading proposal for the Shelton Public Schools that I believe addresses the needs of all students. I believe this decision should not be a one-size-fits-all approach; rather a hybrid with parent choice. Please review the draft grading proposal located at https://resource.echalk.com/sr/aA0HInc0 that will be discussed at the upcoming April 30 virtual special meeting of the Board of Education. Your feedback can be emailed to me (bsmith@sheltonpublicschools.org) or Board of Education Chairperson Kathy Yolish (kyolish@sheltonpublicschools.org).

Thank you in advance for your feedback,
Dr. Smith, Interim Superintendent
text:

Your feedback can be emailed to me (bsmith@sheltonpublicschools.org) or Board of Education Chairperson Kathy Yolish (kyolish@sheltonpublicschools.org).

post_text:
April 8 2020 food communication

The Shelton Public Schools, in conjunction with Whitsons Food Service, will continue to offer
bagged breakfast and lunch free of charge for ALL students 18 and under enrolled in the Shelton Public Schools and Holy Trinity Catholic Academy in Shelton, on Good Friday and every weekday next week. This may be picked up Monday through Friday between the hours of 9:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. in the Shelton High School bus loop. On Friday, you will receive breakfast and lunch for Saturday and Sunday, Some items may need to be refrigerated. PLEASE BRING A BAG with you to transport your food. From 9:00-12:00 Monday through Friday, the high school’s Meadow Street gates will be closed in order to keep the flow of traffic on Meadow Street moving. All participants may enter and exit the high school grounds via the North Constitution Boulevard entrance. We ask everyone to practice social distancing when reporting to the bus loop. Thank you for your cooperation and stay healthy.
text:

The Shelton Public Schools, in conjunction with Whitsons Food Service, will continue to offer
bagged breakfast and lunch free of charge for ALL students 18 and under enrolled in the Shelton Public Schools and Holy Trinity Catholic Academy in Shelton, on Good Friday and every weekday next week. This may be picked up Monday through Friday between the hours of 9:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. in the Shelton High School bus loop. On Friday, you will receive breakfast and lunch for Saturday and Sunday, Some items may need to be refrigerated. PLEASE BRING A BAG with you to transport your food. From 9:00-12:00 Monday through Friday, the high school’s Meadow Street gates will be closed in order to keep the flow of traffic on Meadow Street moving. All participants may enter and exit the high school grounds via the North Constitution Boulevard entrance. We ask everyone to practice social distancing when reporting to the bus loop. Thank you for your cooperation and stay healthy.

post_text: This Friday, March 20th, between the hours of 12:00 p.m. and 2:00 p.m., students will have the opportunity to report to their school to retrieve any materials that they need for distance learning. During this time only parents may retrieve any medications from the school nurses. This will be the last opportunity for students to access anything from their schools during the closure. You will be allowed to gather your materials and leave the building, practicing social distancing at all times. Security may limit the number of people in the building at one time. We thank you in advance for your cooperation.

post_text: I want to update you on our ongoing district plan for COVID-19. The Shelton Public Schools, in conjunction with Whitsons Food Service, will be offering bagged breakfast and lunch free of charge for all students 18 and under enrolled in the Shelton Public Schools and Holy Trinity Catholic Academy in Shelton beginning Wednesday, March 18, 2020. Parents may pick up breakfast and lunch for their children beginning Wednesday (and continuing Monday through Friday during school closure) between the hours of 9:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. in the Shelton High School bus loop. During this time, the high school’s Meadow Street gates will be closed in order to keep the flow of traffic on Meadow Street moving. All participants may enter and exit the high school grounds via the North Constitution Boulevard entrance. I remind parents to continue to check the district website and Facebook page on a regular basis for updates.

During this time, the high school’s Meadow Street gates will be closed in order to keep the flow of traffic on Meadow Street moving. post_text:
For the safety of our students, staff and community, the Shelton Public Schools will be closed tomorrow, Friday, March 13, 2020, until further notice.

Administrators and Twelve month staff should report to work on a regular schedule. Any family that contacted their school and stated they have internet, but do not have access to a computer and did not receive a device today from your school and would like a device, should call the HelpDesk at 203-924-6530 option 1. Further information regarding supplemental learning will be available on the Shelton Public Schools website and District Facebook pages. Please check them frequently for updates. Please continue to take care of yourself and your family during this crisis.
text:
For the safety of our students, staff and community, the Shelton Public Schools will be closed tomorrow, Friday, March 13, 2020, until further notice.

Administrators and Twelve month staff should report to work on a regular schedule. Any family that contacted their school and stated they have internet, but do not have access to a computer and did not receive a device today from your school and would like a device, should call the HelpDesk at 203-924-6530 option 1. Further information regarding supplemental learning will be available on the Shelton Public Schools website and District Facebook pages. Please check them frequently for updates. Please continue to take care of yourself and your family during this crisis.

post_text: After speaking with our Health Director and conferring with our Director of Public Safety and Emergency Management, it has been decided that it is in the best interest of the health and safety of our students to postpone the remainder of our March parent and student led conferences. These conferences will be rescheduled at a later date. We will continue to follow the posted half-days in March that are currently on the calendar.

post_text:
Dear Families,

I write to you to share the news that I will be leaving the district at the end of the month.

It has been an honor to have served with you since 2015 in our efforts to prepare our students for the future.

We have shared joy and sorrow, made music together, celebrated innovation, and stayed strong in the face of challenges.

I look forward to seeing you in the next few weeks.

Thank you for your friendship and collegiality!

-Chris
text:
Dear Families,

I write to you to share the news that I will be leaving the district at the end of the month.

It has been an honor to have served with you since 2015 in our efforts to prepare our students for the future.

We have shared joy and sorrow, made music together, celebrated innovation, and stayed strong in the face of challenges.

I look forward to seeing you in the next few weeks.

Thank you for your friendship and collegiality!

-Chris

post_text:
The Shelton School District is exploring 3-D images of our schools for security and infrastructure purposes. At NO COST to the district, a company has been making a digital 3-D animation of Perry Hill School. The district owns the images.

Depending on the quality and price point, the district will determine at a later time whether or this will become a district-wide initiative.

We believe this has great potential for first responders in case of emergency.

No one in Connecticut has been diagnosed with the coronavirus to date. Attached is the Connecticut Department of Health’s official statement on the Coronavirus and the impact on schools.
Adrianna Collins, MHA, BSN, RN
Nursing Supervisor, Shelton Public Schools

post_text:
To the Elizabeth Shelton School Community,
On the evening of Wednesday, January 22nd, there was an incident in one of the neighborhoods near our school. This incident did NOT occur on school property.
At NO point in time was the school under any threat.
This morning, officers from the Shelton Police Department were checking areas near and around where the incident occurred to determine if anything was left behind. Elizabeth Shelton School grounds was one such area.
I have been in communication with Superintendent Dr. Clouet and Ben Trabka, director of security, who has been in direct contact with the Shelton Police Department.
All the children are safe and student learning has not skipped a beat.

Bev Belden, Principal of Elizabeth Shelton School
text:
To the Elizabeth Shelton School Community,

I have been in communication with Superintendent Dr. Clouet and Ben Trabka, director of security, who has been in direct contact with the Shelton Police Department.
All the children are safe and student learning has not skipped a beat.

post_text:
To the Community of the Shelton Public Schools:
I am saddened to inform you that on the annual Washington D.C. trip
the group from our SIS was thrown out of the Smithsonian’s highly
regarded African American History Museum.

Why?

Because a student, a White male, spit on a Black visitor at the Museum.

This kind of action is not a reflection of who our students are, or
who we are as a community.

This is not the time or place to talk about consequences.

But this is now, regrettably, a pattern of behavior that is
disrespectful and does not serve anyone well —including the student
who acted inappropriately and embarrassed himself and his school.

Yes, we will deal with this at school.

But we need the help and support of families. Please speak to your own
children in an age-appropriate manner about our expectation of how we
treat people: Black or White, elder or young, or anyone, a child (or
adult!) may perceive as being different.

Shelton schools and the Shelton community can do better! We must!

Chris Clouet
Superintendent of Shelton Public Schools

This kind of action is not a reflection of who our students are, or

But this is now, regrettably, a pattern of behavior that is
disrespectful and does not serve anyone well —including the student

Yes, we will deal with this at school.

But we need the help and support of families. Please speak to your own

treat people: Black or White, elder or young, or anyone, a child (or
adult!) may perceive as being different.

Shelton schools and the Shelton community can do better! We must!

Chris Clouet

post_text: The 2019-2020 Bus Routes have been posted at http://www.sheltonpublicschools.org/transportation. We are still waiting for updates from the Shelton Student Transportation Service regarding whether they can determine that they will have sufficient drivers within their service who have been DMV approved for student transportation. For any questions please call the Shelton Student Transportation Services at 203-922-1311

For any questions please call the Shelton Student Transportation Services at 203-922-1311

post_text: This week's Shelton's Word of the Week. #CT126
text: This week's Shelton's Word of the Week. #CT126

post_text:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

I am disappointed to communicate to each of you and your children that the Shelton Public School system will not (repeat: will NOT) open on September 3. This is not the time for blaming or “throwing rocks”, but the simple fact is the City-run Shelton Student Transportation Services project is not ready. We anticipate opening on September 4. Bus runs and further information will follow.

Chris Clouet
text:

Bus runs and further information will follow.

Chris Clouet
